How do I write a SOQL query to get all Accounts with related Contacts?

To get all Accounts with related Contacts using SOQL, you can use a subquery. Here's an example:

SELECT Id, Name, (SELECT Id, FirstName, LastName FROM Contacts)
FROM Account

This query will return all Accounts and include a nested list of related Contacts for each Account. The subquery (SELECT Id, FirstName, LastName FROM Contacts) is enclosed in parentheses and placed in the main query's SELECT clause.

If you only want Accounts that have at least one Contact, you can add a WHERE clause with a subquery:

SELECT Id, Name
FROM Account
WHERE Id IN (SELECT AccountId FROM Contact)

This query will return only Accounts that have at least one related Contact.

How can I use SOQL to find Opportunities closed in the last 30 days?

To find Opportunities closed in the last 30 days using SOQL, you can use the CloseDate field and the LAST_N_DAYS:30 date literal. Here's an example query:

SELECT Id, Name, Amount, CloseDate
FROM Opportunity
WHERE IsClosed = true
AND CloseDate = LAST_N_DAYS:30

This query will return the Id, Name, Amount, and CloseDate of all Opportunities that were closed (IsClosed = true) within the last 30 days.

If you want to include Opportunities closed today as well, you can use LAST_N_DAYS:31 instead:

SELECT Id, Name, Amount, CloseDate
FROM Opportunity
WHERE IsClosed = true
AND CloseDate = LAST_N_DAYS:31

Remember that SOQL date literals are relative to the current date when the query is executed.
